intro: Selago heterotricha, commonly known as the starry sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its distinctive, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Selago heterotricha produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
